intro: Mulgedium floridanum var. acuminatum, commonly known as Florida mulgedium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
